chapter.title: The event creator program
chapter.para: Most experiments will record event data. Event data files are record the data taken from the experiment event by event. The format of event data files is identical to the format of data in ring buffers. See the chapter: Format of EventData In Ring Buffers for a description of what to expect in an event file. The $DAQROOT/include/DataFormat.h header is also helpful as it provides C/C++ structure definitions for data in ring buffers and event files. The event creator program (evtCreator) generates data from randomize gaussian distributions and outputs the result in any ring (local or remote via the networked proxy ring subsystem) or file as specified in the URL for debugging/testing purposes. Primarily, this program has been thought to work for the SpecTcl Skeleton application.
The full reference documentation for the program is in the event creator reference page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate formatted data from Gaussian distributions and output to ring/disk.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Generates event data to ring buffers and disk files. Runs are recorded in files in the target directory as defined by the URL. Options have do not sensible defaults. See OPTIONS below.

listitem.para: Defines the number of parameters one wants to create for SpecTcl.
Defines the number of events to generate following a Gaussian distribution with random seed that changes every event.

Defines the event output as a Ring buffer Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). The URI can be for a local, a remote ring buffer tcp://localhost/name or disk file file://path/name.evt where name is whatever name one wants to choose.
